name: Spinach Ricotta Cannelloni
description: Recipe VIDEO above. Juicy, perfectly seasoned spinach and ricotta filling inside cannelloni pasta tubes, topped with a simple, tasty tomato sauce and melted cheese. Great for freezing!First published in September 2017, this reader favourite recipe is included by popular demand in my debut cookbook Dinner. I took the opportunity to make it even better by increasing the volume and thinning the thickness of the sauce so there's plenty of liquid to cook the cannelloni but it's still saucy when you serve it up. It was great before, it's AMAZING now!
recipeIngredient: 1/2 tsp each dried thyme and oregano
4 cups vegetable or chicken stock/broth (, low sodium)
1/3 cup Chardonnay or other dry white wine ((sub more stock))
2/3 cup basil leaves (, roughly torn (recommended but not critical))
250 g / 8 oz   frozen chopped spinach (, thawed (Note 1))
500 g / 1 lb   ricotta (, full fat please (Note 2))
1 cup shredded cheese ((Mozzarella, Colby, Cheddar, Tasty, Gruyere, Swiss))
Grated fresh nutmeg (just a sprinkling) ( or 1/8 tsp nutmeg powder (optional))
18 - 22  dried cannelloni tubes (250g pack) (or 14 manicotti tubes (8.8 oz) (Note 3))
More basil and parmesan (, for garnish (optional))

itemListElement.text: Sauté - Heat oil in a small pot over medium high heat. Add garlic, onion, bay leaf, thyme and oregano. Cook for 3 - 4 minutes until the onion is translucent. Add tomato paste and cook for 1 minute.
itemListElement.name: Sauté - Heat oil in a small pot over medium high heat. Add garlic, onion, bay leaf, thyme and oregano. Cook for 3 - 4 minutes until the onion is translucent. Add tomato paste and cook for 1 minute.

itemListElement.text: Reduce wine - Add wine, increase heat to high and let it simmer rapidly until mostly evaporated (about 2 minutes).
itemListElement.name: Reduce wine - Add wine, increase heat to high and let it simmer rapidly until mostly evaporated (about 2 minutes).

itemListElement.text: Simmer - Add tomatoes, stock, sugar, salt and pepper. Stir then simmer on medium low for 20 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Simmer - Add tomatoes, stock, sugar, salt and pepper. Stir then simmer on medium low for 20 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Blitz - Remove bay leaf then blitz with a stick blender until smooth. Simmer for 1 more minute then remove from the stove
itemListElement.name: Blitz - Remove bay leaf then blitz with a stick blender until smooth. Simmer for 1 more minute then remove from the stove

itemListElement.text: Basil -  Stir in basil then cover to keep warm until required.
itemListElement.name: Basil -  Stir in basil then cover to keep warm until required.

itemListElement.text: Squeeze spinach - Place spinach in a colander and press out most of the liquid (don't need to thoroughly squeeze dry).
itemListElement.name: Squeeze spinach - Place spinach in a colander and press out most of the liquid (don't need to thoroughly squeeze dry).

itemListElement.text: Mix filling - Place Spinach in bowl with remaining Filling ingredients. Mix, taste, adjust salt and pepper to taste (different cheeses have different saltiness).
itemListElement.name: Mix filling - Place Spinach in bowl with remaining Filling ingredients. Mix, taste, adjust salt and pepper to taste (different cheeses have different saltiness).

itemListElement.text: Pan - Choose a baking pan which will comfortably fit about 20 cannelloni - mine is 21 x 26 cm / 8.5 x 10.5".
itemListElement.name: Pan - Choose a baking pan which will comfortably fit about 20 cannelloni - mine is 21 x 26 cm / 8.5 x 10.5".

itemListElement.text: Smear - Spread 1 cup of Sauce on the base (stops cannelloni from sliding around).
itemListElement.name: Smear - Spread 1 cup of Sauce on the base (stops cannelloni from sliding around).

itemListElement.text: Fill tubes - Transfer Filling to a piping bag with a large nozzle (that fits in the tubes), or use a strong ziplock bag. Or do this step using a knife (it's a bit tedious though!). Pipe the filling into the tubes.
itemListElement.name: Fill tubes - Transfer Filling to a piping bag with a large nozzle (that fits in the tubes), or use a strong ziplock bag. Or do this step using a knife (it's a bit tedious though!). Pipe the filling into the tubes.

itemListElement.text: Assemble - Place cannelloni in baking dish. Pour over remaining Sauce, covering all the tubes.
itemListElement.name: Assemble - Place cannelloni in baking dish. Pour over remaining Sauce, covering all the tubes.

itemListElement.text: Bake covered (but naked) - Cover with foil, then bake for 30 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Bake covered (but naked) - Cover with foil, then bake for 30 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Cheese it! Remove foil, scatter over parmesan then mozzarella. Return to oven for 15 minutes until cheese is melted.
itemListElement.name: Cheese it! Remove foil, scatter over parmesan then mozzarella. Return to oven for 15 minutes until cheese is melted.

itemListElement.text: Serve, garnished with extra parmesan and basil if desired.
itemListElement.name: Serve, garnished with extra parmesan and basil if desired.

review.reviewBody: Winner! When husband who is fussy says it’s the best cannelloni he’s ever had, then this is a keeper recipe. Such great balance of flavour, Thankyou

I made this as a lasagna and it was delicious. I made it in a real hurry for an unexpected visit by a relative who doesn't like vegetables but absolutely loved the lasagna. I doubled the recipe and it made about 10 - 12 servings. I had lots of sauce left over and I probably could have left the last bit of salt out of the ricotta and spinach but it was still ok. I used part fresh English spinach because I had it and part frozen spinach but I'd use the fresh spinach again but allow myself more time to prep  it. With the sauce, I used half diced tomatoes and passata, again because that's what I had on hand. Next time I'm going include slices of roasted butternut pumpkin as alternate layers with the spinach and ricotta. I should be able to make that version with a single quantity of spinach and ricotta filling.
Outstanding! Followed the recipe to a T, the family destroyed it. Thanks!!
This is now a regular family favourite. Even my picky teenager daughter enjoys this meal. Thank you so much for sharing it.

The flavors were nice, but next time I'll use fresh pasta sheets, even if I have to make them myself...which I do sometimes. Or even crepes. The no boil cannelloni tubes came out with a gummy texture that wasn't pleasant. Otherwise, this was tasty.

Made this last night, not expecting to like it very much as I am not a great fan of spinach. Plus I really wondered about making a thin sauce in which the shells were cooked. Boy was I mistaken!! Everyone went back for seconds...THAT hasn't happened in a while as we are all adults who are watching what we eat ( two in our 60s and two in 30s). The only issue was that it took longer than stated, but I expect it to be closer to the stated time next time I make it. I used 13 manicotti shells in a 13 x 9 baking dish and had leftover sauce, which will be used with another recipe. Will be making this on a regular basis....thank you for an interesting and wonderful recipe!!
I'm guessing that's why she labelled it "American-Italian"

I came across your recipe because I didn't want to use the recipe on the pasta box.
It turned out great!
I used a blend of 3 cheeses.
Parmasan, pizza  mozarella, and cheddar.
I also used left over tomato paste and a dab of leftover pizza sauce!
Great recipe!! Highly recommend. I used ricotta and feta with fresh spinach and lasagna sheets. Wanna try the dried tubes next time.

i used your recipe last night, I followed your instructions step by step (minus the bay-leaves & wine for the homemade sauce -- due to not having either of those ingredients on hand ☹️). this meal was so delicious -- my (very critical) boyfriend said, "this is perfect!" (WOW!! 😃). there are plenty of leftovers, which we are looking forward to having for lunch today. thank you so much for sharing your incredible recipe -- i have bookmarked your page and i can't wait to dive into your recipe repertoire to discover some more of your delicious creations!

Nagi, your recipes never disappoint!!😁👏🏼 When I told my hubby and kids I was making this they all groaned (I told the hubby he should eat cereal then!🥴) as I’ve made other ones in the past that were so underwhelming! I knew from experience though that you always add more flavour to your recipes than other sites so continued on defiantly.😅 So I didn’t need to blitz the sauce I bought a 700ml passata. I didn’t have the wine but needn’t have worried as the sauce was still delicious! My mozzarella had mould in it 🙄 so only used fresh Parmesan and tasty cheddar. It was amazing-so flavoursome that I had seconds and all the family loved it! This one will be on rotation now! Thank you!!🥰
Absolutely delicious and great joy to make !!!! Thankyou !!!
Delicious!! Using easy to obtain ingredients. I have used so many of your recipes and haven't had a disappointment yet. Thanks a heap.
So delicious! Best cannelloni recipe I have ever made. Thank you so much for your consistently delicious recipes!
I've made this a couple times as written and we love it
